reviews.text: I CANNOT possibly say enough good things about The Locando Orseolo in Venice... and the only remotley negative thing I can say about it is that it was a "little bit" difficult to find initially (NOTE: you find a coffee / pastry shop, pass thru an iron gate to the immediate left of the coffee shop and walk diaganolly across a courtyard)... First, the location is superb -- being approximately only a block and a half from Pzza San Marco... Second, the rooms were a good size -- with a large comfortable bed, a large bathroom with a tub, and a safe... third, the morning breakfast was incomparable -- even by American standards -- with eggs and crepes made to order, bacon, cold ham/cheese, croissants, biscuits, jams, yogurt, biscotti, cappucino, juices, etc... and lastly, and most importantly, were the people -- the young people who own / manage the place... they were AMAZING! Two brothers, a fiance and a close friend... they understand service... they understand people... they understand what it is like to travel... whether it was ordering our train tickets to Florence (and paying for them and picking them up and having them waiting for us upon departure), or posting / mailing our postcards, or personally escorting us to the Rialto vaporetto stop on departure (and wheeling one of our bags there for us), they could not do enough to make our stay superior. I cannot possibly give these guys high enough praise!!
reviews.title: The BEST Venice has to offer
Booking fiasco
reviews.text: We never got the chance to sample the hotel! We were obviously impressed by the reviews and checked out availability on line. Availability was confrimed by e mail and when we confrimed by credit card were told they had forgotten about us and had given the room to someone else. The simple rule of first come first served might have been a reasonable expectation and that the couple who came after us should have been let down, but one wonders whether they were looking to book for more than four nights and cash won the day. Either way it was pretty shabby, incompetent or both.

reviews.title: Carlo and Sarah's amazing break!
reviews.text: We have just returned from a five day stay at Locanda Orseolo and wanted to give feedback on our experience due to the fact that we went on Trip Advisor's recommendations to book the hotel (which we do not normally do)!! It was the second part of our honeymoon and we wanted it to be as special as possible and we were not disappointed!! Venice is so beautiful and despite critics "Aqua Alta" is magnificent to see, a true experience. As has been said before, Barbara, Matteo, Francesco and Bruno were all absolutely superb and catered for our every need throughout the duration of our stay. Matteo's breakfasts (Omelettes, Crepes, etc) were fantastic and lasted us through our long and tiresome walks - much needed!! The Locanda Orseolo is decorated beautifully and we had one of the superior rooms overlooking the canal. Although busy at times the rooms facing the canal have great views and it is lovely to wake up each morning, open your windows and hear the sound of Venice. Matteo and Francesco recommended some great restaurants, although very pricey they are well worth the visit if you like good food and good wine (hard to find in Venice!!)- we visited Al Paradiso, Fiaschetteria Toscana and Al Fontego which were all fabulous places to eat. We will definitely return to Venice in the future and will without doubt return to the Locanda Orseolo. Recommended to All!! Thank you Barbara, Matteo, Francesco and Bruno for your generous hospitality - it was much appreciated!! xx

reviews.title: Take it from a true skeptic, you will be amazed at the service....
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a week in Italy, spending the first 3 days in Venice.We were lucky enough to believe all the wonderful recommendations and stay at Locando Orseolo.It is a bit tricky to find, but well worth the effort. The warm greeting we received from Francesco, Matteo,Bruno and Barbara when arriving made us feel very welcome after a long day traveling.Without asking,our bags were taken upstairs by Bruno( no lift). The room was beautiful, overlooking the Orseolo canal. It was very romantic watching the gondolas pass , accordian music playing. We would recommend for late risers to opt for the rooms facing the gardens as it does get a bit noisy early from all the local deliveries being made. Breakfast was as good as all the reviews stated ( chocolate crepes are a must!!!) and the omlettes were excellent. Francesco and Matteo recommended and made reservations for us at 2 great restaurants the locals go to(did not want tourist traps), both were amazing and reasonable. The personal service was so refreshing and always genuine. I was even able to use their computer to e-mail my son when to meet us upon our arrival in Florence. As Barbara said to us over our terrific breakfast, " We really love what we do". It really does show. You could not find a more warm, friendly, service oriented place to stay than Locando Orseolo !!!!

reviews.title: One of our top hotels ever
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to Venice. Luckily, we stayed at Locanda Orseolo thanks to TripAdvisor, my new travel bible. This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at, the ambience, the owners, the food, the sounds, the smells, the decoration. It was just great, and I agree, please hotel owners, take a tip from these owners! They are all the best. Upon leaving I told Barbara, 'thank you for making our experience in Venice truly memorable', and I meant it. They made all the difference. Lovely, lovely people! We were on our way to Siena without reservations, and Barbara suggested a hotel that she stays in, it was also fabulous! It can be done, but it is not done very often, perfection! I think it says something that they are booked solid in the off season, and other hotels are half empty. Try it yourself, you will see!

reviews.title: Sustains its reputation - and then some
reviews.text: We planned a very short visit to Venice to celebrate my wife's birthday. Booking at the Locanda Orseolo was simplicity itself and after contacting them by email we received a very warm confirmation of our booking. The hotel is situated just off St Mark's square, but the gate is discrete and the hotel's doorway, even more so - just the heraldic symbol to show you are in the right place! We were greeted by Barbara in a way that made us feel truly welcome. Francesco showed us to our room - with its wonderful wall murals - he told us all the rooms will be upgraded in terms of decoration, this January (2005). The room was wonderful; quality rather than opulence.

reviews.title: It really doesn't get any better
reviews.text: Breakfast was served in a delightful downstairs salon - and offered extensive choice; the crepes were great as were the cappuccinos.

reviews.title: We wanted to move in!
reviews.text: The two reccomendations offered for lunch were outstanding (wonderful food in atmospheric restaurants in easy walking distance); good value and excellent quality.

reviews.title: The Wilson's may have to change our name to 'Peruch'.
reviews.text: Leaving to travel to the airport by water taxi meant stepping out through the window. Romantic or what. Cannot reccommend highly enough. Book and enjoy.

reviews.title: Like a Fairly Tale!
reviews.text: Just returned after a short stay at The Locanda Orseolo for the last two days of our honeymoon in Italy. This hotel is such a fantastic breath of fresh air in a world that claims to be service oriented, pay attention; this is how it should be done. All the praise you read here on trip advisor for Barbara, Mateo, Bruno & Francesco is more than deserved. Our experience started with a welcome from the staff on duty, Barbara, Bruno and Francesco. Each one stepped forward and greeted us in a manner that assured us they were waiting on our arrival and letting us know they were happy to meet us and ready to take care of us. There was no elevator in this small hotel, however without the need to ask for help our bags were carried immediately to our room. The room itself was beautifully decorated and very spacious with a great view over the Orseolo canal basin. The breakfast was first class, with scrumptious omelets and crepes prepared to order by Mateo accompanied by a first class selection of breads, croissants, fruit, cold cuts and homemade preserves. Breakfast can be enjoyed watching the local gondolas drift gracefully past the open windows. I agree with another reviewer that the restaurant recommendations were first class. The location is excellent just steps from St Marks square yet in a quiet courtyard away from the crowds and noise. I cannot say enough good things about our experience in this fantastic hotel. I really hope I will get a chance to stay here again and catch up with the staff, who now feel like our friends in Venice. If you run a business send your managers here if you want them to learn the true meaning of customer service….. Perfetto

reviews.title: What a Treat!
reviews.text: I hate to give away this hidden gem! But if it weren't for others on this site giving such glowing recommendations I would have never found it.

What a great place. The location is excellent - a short walking distance to St. Mark's and the Rialto Bridge. The rooms were clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. The staff - Bruno, Francesco, Matteo and Barbara were the nicest people I have ever encountered while traveling in Europe. They greeted us by name, recommended great restaurants and genuinely cared about our well-being. I usually don't return to the same place more than once, as I feel there are so many places that I haven't yet seen, but I will DEFINITELY be back to Venice just to stay at Locando Orseolo.
reviews.title: A hidden jewel in Venice
This is Venice!!
reviews.text: Are you unsure about taking a risk & booking accommodation using the internet? Well that was us – but thanks to trip adviser & the exceedingly good comments written about Locanda Orseolo, we took that risk. We were not disappointed in anyway. After staying there for 3 nights in November 2004, we felt part of the family we were greeted with hi Phil & Clare everytime we saw a member of staff. Thanks to the warm welcome & friendliness of all the staff – we had a fantastic time. This hotel is a hidden jewel in Venice.

reviews.title: Thank You Barbara, Matteo ,Francesco, Igor for your amazing hospitality
reviews.text: This hotel is wonderfully located only a minute or two from St. Marks. It is charming from the rooms to the lobby and the service is the best. We arrvied on a cool Novmeber morning. They served us a fabulous breakfast of homemade delights plus our room was ready. We stayed for three more days and it was most enjoyable trip to Italy we have had. The hotel offered great restaurant suggestions and let us know what sights were open or closed and the best time to visit. It was like having a personal guide to this city. If you are going to Venice for the first time or the tenth time, this really is the place to stay!!

reviews.title: The only place to stay in Venice
reviews.text: Having stayed at other hotels in Venice, and having been used to 2nd rate service in the this City, the Locanda Urseola was a treat. The service that I my 2 companions recieved was first rate, and I know that this is the place where I will be staying on my next vist to Venice. The location could not be better, the rooms were delightful, and the breakfast area and little lounge inviting. However, it was the hosts and their team that really made our visit. They were fun, and genuinely concerned that we enjoy our stay. Willing to help with dinner reservations and even volunteered to get train tickets! Service like this is worth paying for, and the crepes at breakfast the icing on the cake.

New Yorkers can be viewed as "cynical" at times. However, our family was overwhelmed by the warmth and hospitality of Matteo, Barbara, Bruno and Francesco. From the moment we entered the iron gate, we were greeted like long-lost friends. Although we were situated on the top floor without an elevator (thank goodness they cheerfully carried our bags!), our two rooms overlooked the Orseolo canal and were everything we could have hoped for. Breakfast was a treat (Matteo's crepes and omelets were memorable!). While we hated to leave, our last image was that of climbing through the hotel window into a water taxi for our trip back to the airport... We will always have fond memories of our two nights in this beautiful city at the Locanda Orseolo.
reviews.title: What a find!
Number One
reviews.text: There is a reason this place is ranked so high. It was the best place we stayed during our trip. The family run hotel operates like a swiss watch and Mateo and Barbara could not do enough for their guests. No lift so if you have trouble climbing stairs ask for a lower level room although Mateo would likely carry you up if needed. Breakfast was amazing. Would return in a minute.

reviews.title: Best hotel service I've ever encountered
reviews.text: When planning our trip to Venice, we researched and were basically choosing between two other hotels, when we saw other people's reviews of Locanda Orseolo on TripAdvisor. We changed our minds and booked here because of that, and it was the best decision we ever made. The room was nice and comfortable - not exceedingly fancy, and small (but then all Venice hotel rooms are small). The building, lobby and dining room are all beautifully done. And what everyone else here says is the truth - Barbara, Matteo, Francesco, Bruno and the others here could not be nicer or more hospitable. Every time we walked in the door, whoever was at the desk greeted us by name. Matteo suggested a restaurant for my boyfriend's birthday, where we had one of the two or three best meals we've ever had in our lives. I have traveled a lot, and this is by far the best service I have ever received. I would not dream of staying in another place in Venice.
Spottlessly clean, very helpful and friendly staff, excellent breakfast, can't fault it. Be warned you may need wellies if the water is as high as it was when we were there. Great place.
reviews.title: Lovely Weekend Retreat from hectic Venice
It's all true!
reviews.text: We just returned from spending 3 nights at Locanda Orseolo. It is as wonderful as everyone says. Matteo and Barbara are two of the friendliest, nicest people you'd ever want to meet. Everyone at the hotel remembers your name. Breakfast is wonderful. We went to a bunch of restaurants they recommended and enjoyed every meal. Our room was large and comfortable. Only a few warnings -- the rooms on the courtyard side have no views at all (ours was of laundry drying across the courtyard). Also, the soundproofing could be a bit better, but it's really not a problem, either. The location is extremely convenient -- about 5 minutes from Piazza San Marco and about 10 minutes to Rialto.
